dialogue.text: Hey Makoto. What are you up to?
Hey, Sensei...I was actually just about to go meet up with my mom for dinner, but...
Now I'm curious as to what exactly you're doing here.
You do realize there doesn't have to be a rule specifically advising that males are not allowed in the girls' dorm to just...{i}know{/i} you shouldn't enter, correct?
And yet here I am.
Though...it is rather strange that there {i}isn't{/i} a rule barring males from entry given that there are so many other strangely specific rules in the student handbook.
Am I allowed to talk now or do you want to think about rules for a little while longer?
Apologies. Did you maybe...need something from me?
All I need from you is a good conversation, Makoto.
...I beg your pardon?
A conversation. It's the formal word for when two normal people talk to one another.
I'm so confused. Are you implying that you came all this way, breaking several unwritten rules in the process, to do something as simple as {i}talking?{/i}
There is no such thing as an unwritten rule. If it's not written down, it may as well not exist.
I have many issues with that statement, but for the sake of our {i}conversation{/i}, I will attempt to look past them.
So, what would you like to talk about? I'm all ears for the next several minutes.
Anything really. I kind of just wanted to hang out with you and kill some time before heading home.
Hang out? Like...right now?
Is that a problem? We've hung out before, haven't we?
Yes, it's just...
I wish I knew you were planning on hanging out with me before I made plans with my mom.
I can always come back some other time if you're busy. It's no big deal.
Hmm...Well, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to spare a few minutes.
Is your mom going to be okay with you being late?
Honestly, I doubt she would have shown up on time anyway...so it's not really a big deal.
And, in the event that she's actually on time for once, I can just tell her I was helping out the teacher.
Great idea. Feel free to use me as an excuse whenever you want, Makoto.
To be perfectly honest, Sensei, I have been doing that all year. But I'm glad to know that my occasional tardiness is now teacher-approved.
Oh, speaking of which...I don't think I've ever asked you why you decided to teach at a high school instead of a college or...night school or something.
Was there any reason behind that choice? How different is the salary of a high school teacher compared to that of a college professor?
What sort of benefits are offered? And, in terms of job security-
Makoto, chill. That's way too many questions at once.
Sorry...it's just-
Well, you know how badly I want to be a teacher one day.
I guess I do now.
And I'm sure it might be premature to begin thinking about it now, but I've yet to decide on which level I want to teach at.
I think I'd be best off with college students, but...I also lack a formal college education right now, so I could be very, very wrong about that.
Well, unfortunately, I don't think I'll be of much help to you right now.
I have literally no idea how I wound up where I am and...honestly? I'm not sure if I ever will.
What do you mean by that, exactly?
Are you saying that...life is so unpredictable that even the most focused individuals can get hurled down an unexpected path entirely at random?
Sure, let's go with that.
Hmm...I see.
I guess I never thought of it that way.
I suppose it would be best to just...not focus on that for now then.
At the very least, it will give me a bit more time to focus on keeping a certain {i}someone{/i} in check.
Good idea, Makoto. Miku needs all the help she can get.
I was talking about you, Sensei...
Makoto and I talk for another few minutes before she decides it’s best to start heading over to wherever she's meeting her mom.
I think for a moment about what she would be like as a teacher, but ultimately get sucked into a fantasy I would prefer to not tell you about.
Either way, the night comes to an end. But not before the two of us manage to get a little bit closer...
{i}Makoto’s affection has increased to [makoto_love]!{/i}
